commitResults.messageBody:
Current default setup made

Want to create a new personality and new name

Remove Duke from Duke.java and create Lumi,
refactoring all Duke elements to Lumi

Want to make sure that there is no trace
of Duke

Currently, Lumi was at its base form.

However, it was still very dull and needed some life
and most importantly, randomness!

Enhance Lumi personality with varied intro and goodbye

To show off what I have learnt from the past week, I
wanted to create strings and use the Math library to
randomise the output for intro and goodbye.

Currently, Lumi is only able to show its
character.

However, it is not able to exchange words with
the user.

Lumi echo user, and exits on bye

This is to create a simple interface for interaction.
To make it more personalised, we asked for user's name.
More complicated features will be created in later commits.

Currently Lumi can only read the inputs and echo
back.

We need to create a list function for the user
to keep track of tasks.

Add list function and echo text back to user

Now, we add a list function so that it can confirm
the input of the user. When asked for the list,
Lumi can provide the List in point form for neatness.

commitResults.messageTitle: Mark and unmark list,check remaining tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently I can only add and read from the list.

There is a need to allow the user to know what
tasks they have done and what tasks are
remaining.

Mark and unmark list, and show remaining tasks

By mark and unmarking, the user can properly keep
track of all tasks,and even has a count for remaining
tasks that are not done yet.

Currently, it was using just all just written
to the Lumi.java file which was abit messy.

In the long run, classes should be used so
that we can organise each function.

Create Task class and reorganise structure
of the file

This will ease the chatbot making process
as we create more classes and increase
the complexity of the chatbot.

Currently, the list works fine, but
it does not tell the user when the list
is empty, or when it is full.

The user will not know what is wrong with
the code as the list just does not get
updated.

Consider Edge Case for List, when List
is empty or full.

Using if statements, we will take care of
these exceptions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Create todo, event and deadline tracking
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently Lumi is able to mark tasks and
unmark tasks for the user to keep track.

However, the tasks cannot be categorised.
It also does not show how many tasks are
remaining.

Create todo, event and deadline tracking

This will help with better organisation
of the todo list and ease of visualising
for the user of Lumi.

Currently, the code was all functional but
slightly over the place. Main was also
very cluttered

This needs to change as it will make it
harder for future debugging

Adjust code according to coding standards

That way, the code will be more organised
into its respective functions and the main
will not be as cluttered as before

commitResults.messageTitle: Minor bug fixes, remove magic number
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the code is functional but
it still had some bugs in the code flagged
out by Intellij with warning signs

They did not follow good coding practices and
hence needed to be adjusted accordingly

Minor bug fixes and remove magic number

Now, all the numbers are clearly stated and
there are no more bugs in the code.

Currently Lumi has no way of being tested.

This means if we were to do any editing we
do not know what the actual output is
supposed to be.

Add test case to input.txt

Now, if we were to make any small edits to
Lumi.java we can make sure that it is giving
the right outputs

commitResults.messageTitle: Add edge case, improve UI testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently there is already a semi-
automated testing in place.

But it did not account for the edge cases
and when edge cases ran Lumi crashed.

Add edge case protection, and test cases

Now, Lumi is stronger than ever and ready
to tackle more weird requests

Currently the file is able to do basic
error catching already.

However, without a help page, user will
have difficulty navigating through Lumi.
Testing mode was occurring all the time

Handle error, improve test experience

The user can now use Lumi --test instead
to do testing, and day to day use will
still have randomised intro and goodbye.
All errors also caught.
